name: Fractured American Idol 2010 Trivia Quiz | Fractured TV | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Crystal Bowersox.

	Known as "Mama Sox," Crystal was my first choice for 2010. She has a great bluesy style and she's one of the most genuine contestants I've ever seen on the show. She came in second and seemed fine with it.

Michael Lynche.

	"Big Mike," a new dad and a HUGE guy (a personal trainer) was one of my favorites for Top Five. He has a big, soulful voice and a warm, loving personality. He was "saved" by the four judges, and he made it to fourth place.

Siobhan Magnus.

	Nineteen that year, Siobhan has a one-of-a-kind fashion sense, and an interesting voice. She wasn't my favorite contestant, but I liked her a lot. She is from Cape Cod, Massachusetts.

Simon Cowell.

	2010 was Simon's last season as an AI judge. He isn't especially polite, but I think he may have been the sharpest judge on the panel. He and Ryan Seacrest had an uncomfortably tense relationship during that season. In fact, I think Ryan may have been having a psychotic break of some kind.

Lee Dewyze.

	One of my favorites for Top Three, bashful Lee came into his own during that season. I love his deep, scratchy voice and bluesy style. And he won! Wow. He was definitely the most improved contestant of the season.

Ellen Degeneres.

	Moonlighting from her own show, Ellen turned out to be a great judge. She was funny, insightful, and kind, though not quite as much of a pushover as Paula had been. I love her sparkling eyes.

Andrew Garcia.

	Andrew was one of my favorites for Top Five. Sadly, though, he was voted off on April 14. From a low-income family in Moreno Valley, California, Andrew is a devoted dad. I guess he sort of lost his nerve, but he had flashes of brilliance with his unique, soulful style.

Kara Dioguardi.

	This was singer/songwriter Kara's second year as an AI judge. "Singer/songwriter" was one of her favorite terms, and she often "wanted more" from contestants. Still, she's got good taste and she's a fairly articulate judge. (She's very pretty, too.)

Casey James.

	SO cute! Casey was one of my favorites for Top Three. Sure enough, he came in third, which seemed exactly right to me. He's a superb guitar player and a great rock/blues/country singer. He has fabulous stage presence, too. So CUTE! Love his hair. Love his smile. He seems very natural, too.

Paige Miles.

	She wasn't one of my favorites, but I liked Paige a lot. She's beautiful and lively, and she can really sing--especially loud rock songs like "All Right Now" by Bad Company. Sadly she was voted off the show on March 24.
